meanings.definition: A strong supporter or advocate of a cause or group.
meanings.sent1: She was a dedicated partizan of animal rights, always speaking up for the welfare of creatures.
meanings.sent2: The political candidate gained many partizans through her passionate speeches.
meanings.sent3: The partizan squirrel community rallied together to protect their acorn stash.
meanings.sent4: His unwavering loyalty to the team made him a true partizan of the sport.
meanings.sent5: The young activist emerged as a fierce partizan for environmental conservation.

meanings.definition: A weapon with a long shaft and a broad blade, used in the 16th and 17th centuries.
meanings.sent1: The knight wielded his partizan with skill and precision on the battlefield.
meanings.sent2: During the historical reenactment, the actor brandished a replica partizan.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy warrior accidentally tripped over his own partizan during training.
meanings.sent4: The partizan gleamed in the sunlight as it was displayed in the museum.
meanings.sent5: The blacksmith crafted a sturdy partizan for the medieval fair.
